multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my upper back that has been there for 4 months.
Has the rash changed in size, shape, or color since it first appeared?
The rash has grown larger over the past 4 months.
Do you have any associated symptoms like itching, pain, or fever?
No, the rash is asymptomatic; I don't have any itching, pain, or fever.
Does the rash consist of clear margins and defined patches?
No, the rash has margins that come together into larger areas and a net-like pattern around it.
Do you have any personal or family history of autoimmune diseases or skin conditions?
No, I don't have any personal or family history of autoimmune diseases or other skin conditions.
Have you been exposed to any new products, environments, or medications that could have triggered the rash?
No, I have not been exposed to any new products, environments, or medications that could have triggered the rash.
**Final Diagnosis:** Tinea Versicolor.
